xml.brief: Retrieve information on a single user
xml.desc: Retrieve information on a single user. This method might be also used to retrieve data of the user in who's name the Access Token have been issued. To do this, include the Access Token in your request, and don't include the user_uuid argument.

req.name: fields
req.p: Pipe-separated list of field names which you are interested with. Selected fields will be included in the response. See below for the list of available fields.

opt.name: user_uuid
opt.p: This parameter is optional only when you sign your request with an Access Token (Level 3 Authentication). Otherwise, it is required.

returns.p: A dictionary of fields you have selected. Currently available fields which can be accessed with level 1 authentication:

ul.li: profile_url - URL of the user's Opencaching profile page,
internal_id - internal ID of the user (DO NOT use this! use the uuid as the user identifier),
date_registered - date (ISO 8601, no time) indicating when the user has registered his Opencaching account,
caches_found - number of "Found it" and "Attended" log entries,
caches_notfound - number of "Didn't find it" log entries,

returns.p: Additional fields that can be accessed only with level 3 authentication; for all other reads, the returned value will equal null:

li.p: email_problems - true if there recently have been problems with delivering emails to this user; false if not.
This flag is only supported by some OC sites; other sites will always return false.

returns.p: Additional fields that can be accessed only with level 3 authentication and only for the user of your access token; for all other reads, the returned value will equal null:

li.p: is_admin - boolean; true is user has admin privileges.
disclose_email_sender_address - true if the email address of the user is used as the sender (From:) of emails to other users by default.
Depending on the OC site, this may always be true, always be false or reflect a setting in the user's profile.

returns.p: If given user does not exist, the method will respond with an HTTP 400 error.
